Class Grid2DHelper

Represent a 2D cartesian grid (axis aligned)

    • ny: number

Methods

candidate

  • candidate(p: [number, number]): [number, number]

  • Get the (i,j) position of the intersecting cell. The 4 corners will be

    ``` (i,j), (i+1,j), (i+1,j+1) and (i,j+1)

      y
      ^
      |
      *---* (i+1,j+1)
      |   |

    (i,j) --- --> x

    Parameters

    • p: [number, number]

    Returns [number, number]

flatIndex

  • flatIndex(i: number, j: number): number

  • Given the (i,j) indices of a cell, return its flatten index. This index varies from 0 to nx*ny and is unique for each corner cell of the grid. It is mainly used to get the attribute at a given position.

    Parameters

    • i: number
    • j: number

    Returns number

flatIndices

  • flatIndices(p: [number, number]): [number, number, number, number]

  • Return the flat-indices of the 4 corners of the intersecting cell with point p

    Parameters

    • p: [number, number]

    Returns [number, number, number, number]

forEach

  • forEach(cb: Function): void

  • Iterate aver all points of the grids and call cb = Function(x, y, i, j, flat)

    Parameters

    • cb: Function

    Returns void

getIJ

  • getIJ(p: [number, number]): any

  • Parameters

    • p: [number, number]

    Returns any

interpolate

  • interpolate(p: [number, number], attribute: Serie<IArray>): number | number[]

  • Parameters

    • p: [number, number]
    • attribute: Serie<IArray>

    Returns number | number[]

map

  • map(cb: Function): any[]

  • Iterate aver all points of the grids and generate a new array of the transformed point by calling cb = Function(x, y, i, j, flat)

    Parameters

    • cb: Function

    Returns any[]

positionAt

  • positionAt(i: number, j: number): [number, number]

  • Given the (i,j) indices of a cell (lower-left corner), return its (x,y) position

    Parameters

    • i: number
    • j: number

    Returns [number, number]
